intro: Sesamothamnus benguellensis, commonly known as the Benguellensis sesamothamnus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
